byline.contributor: Richard C. Paddock reported from Kuala Lumpur, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul, South Korea. Reporting was contributed by Chau Doan from Nghia Binh, Vietnam; Fira Abdurachman from Jakarta, Indonesia; and Gerry Doyle and Mike Ives from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By RICHARD C. PADDOCK and CHOE SANG-HUN

lead_paragraph: The Malaysian police said the substance, listed as a chemical weapon, had been identified from samples taken from the skin and eye of the North Korean leader’s estranged half brother.
snippet: The Malaysian police said the substance, listed as a chemical weapon, had been identified from samples taken from the skin and eye of the North Korean leader’s estranged half brother....

headline.main: Kim Jong-nam Was Killed by VX Nerve Agent, Malaysians Say
headline.print_headline: Nerve Agent Killed North Korean Leader’s Half Brother, Police Say
